Here's my thoughts: 

Take a Platinum player. Put them in Silver V.

Compare the rates of climb when they get reset to ~ Gold II on new Season placements vs the Silver Climb.

It's likely going to take them 200-300 more games to climb 5 Brackets on the Silver than their Gold II.

Why? 

Silver V is like a Lottery. it's not about skill, or discipline, split pushing OR team play. It all goes out the window.

Even if you have an illusion of skill in that elo, where your team dominates 25 to 5, that's usually all it is. An Illusion. Some or a couple on your team managed to get a very early First Blood/snowball, and create the illusion of a skill match, supported by gear and the charisma given to a team by a lead.

And no matter how skilled you are in that elo..... a lottery team results in situations where unless you're playing a perma reset champ like {{champion:157}} {{champion:67}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:84}} {{champion:121}} {{champion:55}} {{champion:39}} ..... you still at best barely pull 50% win rates, even if you historically have 65% Kill participation and a 8 KDA.

The problem arrives from the fact that literally 55% of the population is in Silver, and about 20% are Bronze. About 75% of the community isn't actually learning game proficiencies. They are playing by impulse/for "fun." and many just play retaliatory toward teammates who offend them.

So..... technically..... in some cases.... Yes. Shitty teammates do prevent climbs. However, in some of those cases, it's also the complainer. 

I've been Plat II or better since Season 4.
But..... I have 3 perma bans. I've had accounts start at Silver/Bronze to insufferable placements. Whereas I can go Gold V to Plat IV in about 100 games, Silver accounts I sometimes don't even get up to Gold in 300-400 games, because gameplay in silver is entirely different than in Gold or Plat. 

Plat: Quick to take advantage of team mistakes, but generally cautious lane phases, and laners help ward for junglers. Routinely buys Control Wards, and tries to keep early game deaths to a minimum. The game usually doesn't break out until after about 12 minutes.

Gold: Usually quick to take advantage of team mistakes, but often gets caught in Yolo lane skirmishes which starts a lane snowball. However, Junglers usually help compensate and minimize that poor decision making, softening it out. Covers junglers about 70% of the time. Buys some Control wards, and tries to keep game deaths to a minimum..... until the snowball starts. Game USUALLY doesn't break out until 10 minutes, but often drives hard to end the game once it does. Hard to stop the snowball.

Silver: No one's really taking advantage of team mistakes. Instead they make a contest of who can make the least mistakes. Often gets tunneled on farming or pvp, or on base defense, but not all at the same time (Not multitaskers). They ward for themselves, or don't ward at all. They don't usually care about protecting a jungler at all, but still expect the jungler to be in their lane at all times. Junglers do not know how to use Drakes/objectives for the most part. Bot laners don't know that Drakes are team objectives, and almost ALWAYS recall when a Drake window arises. Buys about 3 total control wards a game. They view deaths as inconveniences but don't ever try to avoid them. Almost all chase kills, and the supports/tanks often die in the process of trying to save the chasers. 

Game often breaks out within 6 minutes, which sabotages cs rates, stable lane phases, and unless you are a hyper reset champ on a smurf, generally creates an entirely different game dynamic that's hard even for smurfs to adjust to. This means one team's adc is almost always useless because it takes twice as long to buy their first full item, which means csing is far less reliable. It means support's Levels are crippled by their adc's performances. It means Jungler's CS gets taken over by laners who care more about padding their gold than the fact they are bullying their own jungler's gold supply. It means almost all drakes are 1 team endeavors, because the losing team doesn't have enough pressure to even create a skirmish there, and the team's are usually not interested in congregating anyways.

The only real difference between Silver and Bronze? Silver players have moderate reaction times. Bronze doesn't react at all, and often freezes in place not knowing what to do.

I climbed from Bronze 1 to Plat last season, this season my other account that was in Silver (with not a good MMR, mind you), and I can easily win most of my games. 

Contrary to what people believe in Silver, good KDA/cs DOES NOT equal carrying the gam. Carrying the game however usually means you have a good KDA and CS. Pulling 9 cs/min doesn’t mean shit if you can’t take towers, or make rotations in time to help your team. Having an amazing KDA doesn’t mean anything unless you know how to shove your advantage so far down the enemy’s throat that they’re bitching and moaning and crying in all chat. 

It’s stupid easy to climb out of Silver. It gets harder to climb the closer to your actual elo you get.

..... and this season you've played a total of some 15 Ranked games, and are still at the elo you placed at: Gold II.

Season 7 ranking was easy. I went 72% on this account before the {{champion:28}} rework, which is why I made this account. I used to run AD Eve, so the rework needed a new account to practice on the rework. 

It didn't help that 1) the new Evelynn wasn't designed for the old runes (she couldn't even survive in a Baron pit because she had no defenses, no way to heal, etc) and 2) October was the Season of the Elo boosting Challengers playing alts to pass time and make money. (Gold was filled with Challenger level players playing {{champion:238}} {{champion:121}} {{champion:59}} who all own Eve's jungle pre 6 if they invade).

After encountering a ton of Elo boosters, My Eve plummeted clear down to 13%. Most of those games even had positive Eve Scores... but I couldn't carry vs these mobile smurfs.

I lost like 11 ranks in a row, because Evelynn was just so ill suited and unexplored. But.... by the end of Season 7, this throw away account had Eve up to something like 43%, so I did make a massive recovery. Was probably winning closer to 65% by the end.

And then I used this account to try out Zoe. That's pretty much what this account was for. Throw away to learn new champs. But..... on Sona/Nami: I was up 72% win rates.

That was season 7. The season where you could still pull large win rates.

This is Season 8. 
The season of Yi 1 shots and 4 Shield Yasuos and reduction of gold value/AP values for mages and overbuffed Thunderlord's Decree (Electrocute) which kills people before they can react. 
It's the season of 8 ways to mitigate AP damage, but Physical damage getting converted to True damage, and Melee's getting Guinsoo procs in 3 hits (1 in the case of Yi). 
It's the season of 7 Major nerfs to Supports in gold incomes, AP values, tankiness, and their early game kits, while at the same time, assassins get buffs and adc's get major duel buffs. 
It's the season of a major removal of viable agency among AP junglers, through mob HP restructures, damage, which affected their clear speed/sustain ({{champion:76}} was a 63% win pick in Season 7. Now she barely gets played at all and is something like 48%.
It's the season of Tanks being able to do the same if not more damage than carries, making team fights almost always about 4-5 major damage sources.

The game is no longer really balanced. There's about 12 "must have on your team champs," or the game is going to strickly rely on major mistakes to create wins. Assuming everyone on your team is competent, those 12 champs run the games.

And I don't play those 12 champs.

Try climbing out of Silver with Evelynn. 3/4 of your games.... your team feeds 10 kills and entire bot pressure depriving you of drakes, a jungle, and farm. You might end up positive KDA every game, but Evelynn at that elo certainly doesn't create carry pressure. They also all push to the opposing turret, so there are no good ganks, which means you either have to wait on spawn or risk invading the other jungle, assuming the other jungler isn't fed. She's just an inconvenience.

Look, teammates as skilled as yours will usually be in the enemy team as well (with some random times smurfs come along).
If you feel like your team mates are dragging you down every game, this means you cannot exploit the enemy teammates. So, you are not better than the enemy.
That's all there is to it.

The stronger the enemy is, the more we rely on our team to deal with it. Therefore, once the enemy are around a similar level to ours, we start seeing more flaws in our teammates because we rely on them more.
Hence, is not as much as your team mates holding you back. But the fact that you aren't better and you reached your "limit".

Up to Season 7 had the Capability - if your initial placements started you well. Your earliest ranked games = your most LP per game you will every get.

If you played some 500+ Norm games to get your initial Placement matches in your very first season on an account to a good starting MMR, and got a 8/2-10/0 Placements, You could start ~ Gold V - Gold III.

From there, 25 games to Plat V isn't hard. You start with solid LP gains, good players (Gold players generally don't slack off in core competencies and are able to carry one bad actor), and yeah. I can believe that can result in a good climb.

But.... after this account got Banned in December, I made ANOTHER alt account. Had about a 68% win rate in Norms. I waited 2 1/2 weeks to rank its first season in Season 8.

I didn't wait long enough. By week 2 1/2 of Season 8, Placements were still full of int feeders and displaced account remakers (people who got banned, made new accounts, but were all in the same melting pot)

First 7 games literally had 3 people run it down the mid, because they didn't care about winning..... just about getting over their placements.... because they just expected to get placed like crap. 

The other 4 games had 2-3 players who went 16 deaths or worse who either didn't care, or were just severely out of elo. Some of the games were 3 First Season placers. I think I even recall a Tristana who literally would freeze when she was embattled. Just.... stop moving.... stop attacking.... not know what to do.

That account got placed in Silver V.

You can't even Mathematically get to Plat V from Silver V in 25 games. That's not even enough games to get to Gold V winning 100%. You might reach Silver III, at which case you are still carrying 4 minute Turret loss Bronzies.

Also, Season 8 is a VERY different ranking beast than previous seasons. I've been around since Season 4. Go build another account and compare Season 8 with the new runes and nerfed/buff item rotations and compare it to previous seasons. Other players are generally right that Riot removed the carry potential this season from the averages. You need at least 1 good person on your team on average to pull off a carry now, whereas you used to be able to carry on singular performance.

I'm pulling 68-70% Kill participations on {{champion:25}} support and can still lose with scores like 8/4/30, because I'm often stuck defending lanes while the team is feeding. If someone would rotate out of the team fights and protect their friggin base, I could leave, and go carry the team fight instead, and perhaps less people would die. but in 80% of the games I play, no one does that. They fight 4v5's while 2 of our lanes are full of siege minions, and no one's killing waves on ANY lanes. 

They also weakened how fast mages can split push turrets.

I personally despite ranked games (one of the reasons I play so little ranked games).

Also, I've played in season 8, albeit only normal games (and pre season 8). I can say that Akali did lose 'carry' power do to how much safe picks started to be played around that time (a lot of janna, tham, lulu). 
I don't know the soloq/normals meta, but if there's less defensive supports, then assassins can still do well and carry.

What I played a lot in pre s8 and s8 was jungle, {{champion:28}} in particular. Since her rework (when she was the most uter trash jungle of them all), I decided to play jungle once more and pick her up (because i liked her and she wasn't op at that time).
I could still influence my games a lot. 
But she suffered the same problem as Akali, defensive supports like lulu, janna, etc prevent the assassination of enemy targets.
So yeh, i know how the new runes work and all that.
